decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, hand disruption, and card advantage. Kess, Dissident Mage allows the player to recast instants and sorceries from their graveyard, providing additional value and flexibility. The deck includes a wide range of versatile spells such as Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, Counterspell, and Cryptic Command to deal with threats and control the board. Additionally, there are card draw spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, with a mix of fetch lands, shock lands, and utility lands to support the control game plan.

The deck revolves around fast and aggressive creature plays, backed up by efficient removal spells and combat tricks. Tajic, Legion's Edge leads the charge by providing haste and protection to the other creatures. The deck includes a mix of powerful one-drop creatures like Goblin Guide and Figure of Destiny, along with versatile removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression, while using removal spells to clear the way for the creatures to deal damage efficiently and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By playing efficient creatures like Najeela, the Blade-Blossom and utilizing cards like Boros Charm and Chain Lightning, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with lands like Cavern of Souls and Command Tower providing necessary mana fixing. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt to deal with any threats from the opponent. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to maintain a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle to pressure the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Reyhan, Last of the Abzan and Tymna the Weaver to create a powerful aggro strategy. The goal is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Kitchen Finks, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also includes versatile cards like Birthing Pod and Aether Vial to generate additional value and pressure. In addition, there are powerful tutor effects such as Demonic Tutor and Worldly Tutor to find key pieces like Umezawa's Jitte or Parallax Wave. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color identity, allowing for consistent and explosive plays.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around Arahbo, Roar of the World as the commander. With a focus on low-cost creatures and combat tricks, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and then buff them with Arahbo's ability to deal massive amounts of damage. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Leonin Arbiter, along with support cards like Ajani, Caller of the Pride and Mother of Runes to protect and enhance your creatures. By applying constant pressure and utilizing cards like Gaddock Teeg and Thalia, Heretic Cathar to disrupt your opponent's strategies, the deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck revolves around utilizing Grenzo, Dungeon Warden as the commander to create a fast-paced aggro strategy focused on goblins. It includes a wide range of goblin creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent with their numbers and synergy. The deck also includes various powerful spells and artifacts like Demonic Tutor and Skullclamp to control the board and maintain card advantage. It aims to be proactive and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game while utilizing cards like Goblin Chieftain and Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin to boost the strength of the goblin army. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent mana production.

This control deck revolves around utilizing a combination of instants, sorceries, and creatures to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan. With Kess, Dissident Mage as the commander, the deck focuses on maximizing the value of casting spells from the graveyard. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and versatile spells like Fiery Confluence, Kolaghan's Command, and Cryptic Command to maintain control of the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance, Liliana of the Veil, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide additional card advantage and board control. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands, dual lands, and utility lands to ensure consistent mana production throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to generate infinite mana with High Tide and various untap effects, then utilize Teferi, Temporal Archmage's -10 ability to take multiple extra turns, locking opponents out of the game by preventing them from untapping any permanents. The deck is focused on countering and bouncing threats while digging for combo pieces to assemble the win condition. Additionally, it includes card draw and manipulation to ensure consistency in finding the combo pieces needed to execute the game plan effectively. The goal is to control the game and outvalue opponents by leveraging Teferi's powerful abilities and overwhelming them with extra turns and resource denial.
